definitions: To reserve (a seat, a table, a room, etc.) in advance.
To arrange to have (a service, a performer, etc.) at a particular time.
To record (a name or an event) in a book or register.
To charge (someone) with an offense; to make an official record of (an arrest).
examples: I need to book a flight to New York.
They booked a band for the wedding.
The police booked him for speeding.
She booked a table at the restaurant.
